title: Boyzone kept band going to honour Stephen Gately as they mark 10 years since his death
text:
Boyzone opened up about honouring Stephen Gately on 10-year anniversary of his death (Picture: ITV)

Boyzone have opened up about honouring Stephen Gately’s memory, on the 10-year anniversary of his death.

The Love Me For A Reason singer sadly passed away from a heart defect back in 2009, aged 33.

And, during an appearance on Loose Women, Ronan Keating, Shane Lynch, Keith Duffy and Mikey Graham opened up about wanting to keep his memory alive between themselves.

Speaking about their final tour, Ronan told the ITV panellists: ‘I think it was something we all felt. After Stephen passed, the band really changed. It wasn’t the same band anymore, things changed.

‘We thought it was the right to come back, make another album and continue on. [But] it just felt different. The chemistry between us was different.

‘What was special was, when the four of us were together, we felt he was in the room and on the stage with us. We didn’t want that to go away so we kept that going.

Stephen died in 2009, following a heart defect (Picture: Getty)

Stephen’s bandmates still feel him on stage with them (Picture: Getty)

While Keith agreed that their Thank You And Goodnight offering was the ‘best’ way to call time on things.

‘It’s the best work we’ve ever done…,’ he said. ‘Without Stevo it’s the best work we ever did. I don’t think we could ever beat it.’

When asked if they get a sense that Stephen is with them in spirit, during their performances, Shane added: ‘100%. When we’re together and we have Stevo and we’re on stage…

Stephen died aged 33. (Picture: ITV)

‘We’re always a five-piece on stage, that’s how we always see it.

‘You can’t physically see him on stage, for us emotionally, it’s very alive, we’re a five-piece on stage.

‘It’s a nice celebration.’

The panellists then cleared out as they performed a special version of No Matter What, while pictures of Stephen and the band were shown on screen.

Loose Women continues on weekdays, at 12.30, on ITV.
